attributes.action: Make multi-layer material consumer food packaging compostable by 2030 in the UK
attributes.additional_details: The UK can set the example, leading change in the global market using our consumer power. Producers must adapt to a changing world, and shift to working under a circular economy. This legislation can begin this change. Although supplementary, we must look past recycling to instead reduce the use of plastic, reverse waste pollution and the growing damage of micro plastics. Our consumption can be reformed and this ambition to reduce our plastic production can be realised with this call for change.
attributes.background: Parliament must vote to make mixed material consumer food packaging in the UK compostable and a legal requirement by 2030. Multi-layer material packaging e.g. crisp packets must use compostable packaging such as PLA. Goods that do not meet these regulations by 2030 will be taxed.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

It's not clear if you want the Government to ban multi-layer consumer food packaging that isn't compostable, or just introduce additional taxes for packaging that isn't compostable.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
